decisions.what: Switched pre-checkout-selection-service staging traffic 100% to FTCP cluster
decisions.context: Infrastructure migration to FTCP cluster for staging environment

decisions.what: Disabled and re-enabled menu on CCM to fix staging menu loading issues
decisions.context: Weekly menu page was broken and not loading on staging, blocking E2E tests

decisions.what: Escalated reactivation substitution issue to Cart Foundation Squad for upstream solution
decisions.context: Current substitution approach only works on planned boxes, not reactivations, causing popular cuts to remain in selections

entities.name: squad-nv-good-chop
entities.context: Support channel for Good Chop brand issues including E2E tests, menu configuration, and code reviews

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: White-label brand with weekly menu, checkout flows, and cut selection features

entities.name: pre-checkout-selection-service
entities.context: Service handling pre-checkout selection logic, migrated to FTCP cluster

entities.name: Box-Content-Service
entities.context: Service that handles menu substitutions in customer selections and planned boxes

entities.name: Cart Foundation Squad
entities.context: Maintains Box-Content-Service, escalation point for substitution enhancement requests

entities.name: CCM
entities.context: Content Configuration Management system for menu and addon configuration

entities.name: U0251UW1YUE
entities.context: Primary responder providing E2E troubleshooting guidance and executing menu substitutions

blockers.description: E2E test checkoutWithFreeAddonsPopup.spec.ts failing on master due to API returning 500 instead of 200
blockers.impact: PR #57229 blocked; caused by auth service incident with cascading failures

blockers.description: E2E test checkoutWithAddOnForLife.spec.ts failing on master, weekly menu page not loading on staging
blockers.impact: PR #57375 blocked; resolved by toggling menu in CCM

blockers.description: Multiple Cypress tests failing due to Good Chop weekly menu not loading on staging
blockers.impact: PR #57380 blocked; resolved by CCM menu toggle

blockers.description: E2E test checkoutWithTrialBoxWithCutsSelection.spec.ts failing and blocking PR
blockers.impact: PR #57995 blocked; test instability resolved after rerun

blockers.description: Reactivations still showing high occurrences of substituted indexes (1 and 277) despite planned box substitutions
blockers.impact: Popular cuts remain in reactivated customer selections; escalated to Cart Foundation Squad for upstream solution

blockers.description: No free-cuts-menu configured in CCM for week 2026-01
blockers.impact: Customers unable to select free cuts for week 2026-01

action_items.task: Review PR #57531 for editMenuConfig collation by brand and country
Substitute indexes 1 and 277 with 353 for W40-W51 and W52
Open support request in Cart Foundation Squad channel for upstream reactivation substitutions
Configure free-cuts-menu in CCM for week 2026-01

key_context.summary: Team established pattern of checking for staging incidents, API errors, and service health before escalating E2E failures. Auth service incident caused cascading E2E failures that resolved after rerunning tests.
key_context.relevance: Reduces unnecessary escalations and helps developers self-diagnose common E2E failure patterns

key_context.summary: Current Box-Content-Service substitutions only work on planned boxes, not reactivations. Popular substituted cuts (indexes 1, 277) continue appearing in reactivated customer selections, requiring upstream solution from Cart Foundation Squad.
key_context.relevance: Impacts customer experience and inventory management; requires architectural enhancement to handle reactivation flows

key_context.summary: Multiple incidents of staging menu not loading and E2E tests failing due to CCM configuration issues. Quick fixes involve toggling menu settings in CCM, but indicates potential stability concerns.
key_context.relevance: Affects developer productivity and PR velocity; may indicate need for more robust staging environment monitoring

key_context.summary: Pre-checkout-selection-service staging traffic fully migrated to FTCP cluster. Team monitoring for issues in dedicated channel.
key_context.relevance: Infrastructure change that could impact service behavior and requires monitoring for regressions

key_context.summary: Missing free-cuts-menu configuration for future weeks (2026-01) causing customer-facing errors. Requires proactive configuration management.
key_context.relevance: Direct customer impact; highlights need for better forward-planning processes for menu configuration

summary: Squad-nv-good-chop channel handles Good Chop brand support including E2E test failures (mostly resolved via staging environment fixes), menu substitutions across multiple weeks, and infrastructure migration to FTCP cluster. Key ongoing issue: substitutions don't work for reactivations, requiring escalation to Cart Foundation Squad.
